answers.text:
Hi Bobbi, 
Thank you for your great question on fleet replacement policies. ICMA has many articles, documents, and case studies on this topic. Here are the articles which I think may be the most relevant to you as you evaluate your current policy. However, feel free to search fleet replacement policy on the Knowledge Network is you want even more documents.
•   Here is a previously answered question which addresses the inflation factor that should be used when making projections for future fleet replacement. http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/kn/Question/20403
•   Here are the results of a survey done by ICMA’s Center for Performance Measurement (CPM) on fleet replacement, specifically with regards to police vehicles. http://icma.org/en/Article/102227/Police_Fleet_Management
•   “Driving Down Fleet Costs” is an article by Peter Christensen and Susan Thorpe on how the city of Peoria in Arizona operates their fleet replacement plan. This article is very detailed and would likely be a good starting point for you. icma.org/Documents/QuestionAnswer/Document/7254
I hope you find these articles and links helpful as you re-evaluate your plan!
Best, 
Robin Saywitz 
ICMA Knowledge Network Intern
rsaywitz@icma.org

author: Bobbi Lloyd
text: The City of Tempe, Az is re-evaluating and formalizing its fleet services vehicle replacement policies.  Examples of your vehicle replacement methodology and financial policies related to municipal fleet replacement would be greatly appreciated.
title: Fleet Vehicle Replacement Policies
